metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28286 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Due to a layout change, iframe contents could have been rendered outside of its border. This could have led to user confusion or spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8, Firefox < 99, and Firefox ESR < 91.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
